title: Lily-Rose Depp wears red dress for Bella Hadid's birthday in New York
text:
She's developed a growing reputation as an actress, but screen was traded for style as Lily-Rose Depp made her latest public appearance on Thursday evening.

The daughter of Hollywood legend Johnny Depp and French star Vanessa Paradis looked typically stunning in a red sleeveless dress as she made her way home after celebrating supermodel Bella Hadid's 23rd birthday in New York.

The fitted design drew attention to her slender physique as she made her way out of Manhattan venue L'Avenue at Saks Fifth Avenue, where she joined a host of stars in toasting Hadid's special day.

Looking good: She's developed a growing reputation as an actress, but screen was traded for style as Lily-Rose Depp made her latest public appearance on Thursday evening

Lily-Rose, 20, added to her look with a pair of black peep-toe heels, while a matching black jacket was casually tucked under one arm as she made her way towards a waiting car.

Drawing further attention to her naturally pretty features, the model and actress opted for deft touches of make-up, selected from a soft colour palette.

Seemingly in high spirits, Lily greeted onlookers with a warm smile while making her way across the sidewalk.

Stylish: Lily-Rose looked typically stunning in a red sleeveless dress as she made her way home after celebrating supermodel Bella Hadid's 23rd birthday in New York City

Lily-Rose developed an early reputation as a model with notable catwalk appearances for French fashion house Chanel.

She has since followed in her father's footsteps by branching into film, with a prominent role as Catherine of Valois in new movie The King, in which she stars alongside boyfriend Timothée Chalamet

Lily-Rose recently revealed that sharing the screen with the Beautiful Boy actor was 'nerve-wracking,' because he's so talented.

Don't mind me: The fitted design drew attention to her slender physique as she made her way out of Manhattan venue L'Avenue at Saks Fifth Avenue

Let's go: The model and actress covered up in a black bomber jacket while making her way towards a waiting car

She said': 'It's always exciting to work with somebody who you know has given themselves so wholeheartedly to their role and is so invested.

'It can be nerve-wracking to work with people whose talent you admire so much, but hopefully it can only make things better...

'It can be intimidating. But I think you can take it like that, or like, "How lucky am I to be working with so many people who are so great at what they do, and hopefully I can learn from them." '
